title: Kiki Dee: ‘I’ve turned down I’m a Celebrity before, but I’d be tempted by Strictly’
text:
Kiki Dee, 72, started out as a backing singer in the Sixties and became the first British artist to sign with Tamla Motown Records. She is best known for the hit singles I’ve Got the Music in Me and Don’t Go Breaking My Heart, the duet she performed with Sir Elton John, which topped the UK and US charts.

She continues to perform and produce albums with the guitarist Carmelo Luggeri. She lives in Hertfordshire.

How did your childhood influence your work ethic and attitude towards money?

I get my drive from my dad, who worked as a weaver overlooker in Bradford. He tried to start a few businesses, including a firm that wove fabric for men’s ties, but he never succeeded in getting them off the ground....
description: Kiki Dee, 72, started out as a backing singer in the Sixties and became the first British artist to sign with Tamla Motown Records.
